author: Matt Helmer, opinion contributor
description: Economic stress and instability among parents, caregivers and educators can have a negative impact on children's success, highlighting the need for businesses and governments to invest in good jobs, care infrastructure, and labor laws that support workers and their families.
title: When adults can’t make ends meet, kids pay the price

author: Tara Suter
description: The Trump family’s cryptocurrency venture World Liberty Financial has opened trading for its new digital currency, dubbed $WLFI, according to the company’s website. “Big day – @WorldLibertyFi just launched the $WLFI token. This isn’t some meme coin, it’s the governance backbone of a real ecosystem changing how money moves,” Donald Trump Jr., President Trump’s eldest…
title: Trump family’s World Liberty Financial token opens for trading

author: Mark G. Schmeller, opinion contributor
description: Martin Van Buren lost his bid for reelection in 1840 amidst accusations that he lived in “regal splendor” in the “President’s Palace.”
title: When extravagant White House renovations helped end a presidency

author: Nick Jachim
description: There's a good chance many states in the northern part of the U.S. will catch a glimpse of the northern lights to round out the holiday weekend.
title: Where in the US can you see the northern lights tonight for Labor Day?

author: Rio Yamat
description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — For a few hopeful weeks this summer, a bright billboard on the major highway linking Toronto to New York greeted Canadian drivers with a simple message: “Buffalo Loves Canada.” The marketing campaign, which included a $500 gift card giveaway, was meant to show Buffalo’s northern neighbors they were welcome, wanted and missed. At first,…
title: A downturn in international travel to US may last beyond summer, experts warn

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Related video – DC Bureau: Changes Atop the CDC Former directors of the Centers of Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Monday rebuked Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. for his leadership at the agency and for his decision to fire its director, Susan Monarez. In a New York Times op-ed,…
title: Former CDC directors sound alarm over Kennedy’s agency shake-up

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: As September begins, Republicans remain on the defensive, and this time they won’t be able to call a time-out.
title: Bad news awaits Republicans returning to DC

author: Alix Martichoux
description: Health experts have been sounding the alarm for years on Candida auris, a drug-resistant fungus that's hard to diagnose, hard to eliminate and hard to treat once it takes hold.
title: Candida auris: Study reveals who is most vulnerable to deadly fungus infection

author: Rep. Donald Norcross (D-N.J.), opinion contributor
description: On Labor Day, we celebrate America’s workers and remember those who fought for the eight-hour workday, higher wages, and benefits for all workers. None of this would be possible without the hard work of South Jersey’s own Peter J. McGuire, the father of Labor Day and a founding member of the American Federation of Labor…
title: The father of Labor Day showed how to advance the labor movement today

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Hundreds of people were left dead after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck east Afghanistan late Sunday. Approximately 800 people were killed and more than 2,500 people were injured, according to the latest tally provided Monday by the Taliban government. The initial earthquake hit at 11:47 p.m. local time and was centered roughly 17 miles east-northeast…
title: Hundreds dead after 6.0 magnitude earthquake rocks Afghanistan

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D) would not rule out a 2028 run for president when asked repeatedly about his political future in a Sunday interview. “I’m not thinking about— that’s too far away,” Pritzker said on CBS News’s “Face the Nation,” regarding the next Democratic candidate for president. “Let’s talk about the 2026 election.” The…
title: Pritzker on 2028: ‘I don’t know what the future holds’

author: Kaylee Lindenmuth
description: HERSHEY, Pa. (WHTM) — A child is safe thanks to the help of some Good Samaritans after what officials called a brief walk along the monorail tracks at Hersheypark. Nexstar’s abc27 News viewers sent in photos and video of the child on the tracks and subsequent rescue. One photo showed the child walking along the…
title: VIDEO: Young child rescued after walking along Hersheypark Monorail tracks
